item.title: Biden Will Link Fight for Ukraine With Allied Effort on D-Day
item.description: President Biden will use a speech in Normandy on Thursday to link the United States’ commitment to Ukraine with the Allied victory in World War II, arguing that the United States must continue to stand up for democracy and freedom around the world.

item.title: D-Day at 80
item.description: : The Battle of Normandy D-Day at 80: The Battle of Normandy D-Day at 80: The Battle of Normandy D-Day at 80: The Battle of Normandy

item.title: A Surging Hard Right in Europe Stumbles Over Its Own Divisions
item.description: The European Union is facing a crisis of legitimacy, with the rise of populist, nationalist parties that are challenging the very foundations of the bloc. These parties, which have gained significant ground in recent years, are united by their opposition to immigration, their skepticism of globalization, and their rejection of the EU’s institutions and values.
